definition: short speech given in proposing a toast
surname Zhu
to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard
wine (esp. rice wine)/liquor/spirits/alcoholic beverage/CL:杯[bei1],瓶[ping2],罐[guan4],桶[tong3],缸[gang1]
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: The president will make a speech and propose a toast first, and then the dinner will start.
sentences.chinese: 校长先要致祝酒辞并向大家敬酒，然后就开始了。

sentences.english: Look up the date of the next full moon and celebrate with a champagne toast.
sentences.chinese: 看日期，在未来充分月球和庆祝与香槟致祝酒辞。

sentences.english: He gave a toast at the party and with that he sat there with no sound.
sentences.chinese: 他做完祝酒辞，然后一声不响地坐在那里。

sentences.english: The two leaders proposed enthusiastic toasts respectively.
sentences.chinese: 两国元首先后发表了热情洋溢的祝酒辞。

definition: short speech given in proposing a toast
to drink a toast
opening speech (at a conference)
congratulatory speech
to toast/to propose a toast
to toast sb (with wine etc)/to drink a toast
message of congratulation
to make a speech/to make some remarks
conventional greeting/polite formula
prologue of play/opening remarks/preamble (of speeches, articles etc)
to drink a toast/Cheers! (proposing a toast)/Here's to you!/Bottoms up!/lit. dry cup
wine goblets and gambling chips lie intertwined/to drink and gamble together in a large group (idiom)/a big (drinking) party
reply/thank-you speech
to urge sb to drink alcohol
variant of 悼詞|悼词[dao4 ci2]
to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
